perturbation.original_text: Party B will be responsible for advertising operation of the real estate channel. Party B has sole discretion to conduct advertising operation, and any gains, liabilities, duties, taxes and expenses arising therefrom will be owned or paid by Party B.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B will be responsible for advertising operation of the real estate channel. The Online Housing Company retains full control over advertising operations, and any gains, liabilities, duties, taxes and expenses arising therefrom will be owned or paid by Party B.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Party B has sole discretion, while the modified version uses 'Online Housing Company' (referring to Party B) but then states they 'retain full control.' This creates ambiguity as to who ultimately controls advertising operations, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 5.10 Party C will be severally and jointly liable for any and all obligations of Party B under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.10 The Leju Information Services Company will be severally and jointly liable for any and all obligations of Party B under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Party C's liability and references 'Party C', whereas the modified version replaces 'Party C' with 'The Leju Information Services Company' (referring to Party C). It is unclear if 'Leju Information Services Company' assumes a different level of liability compared to 'Party C'.

perturbation.original_text: 8.3 Any Party (the "Receiving Party") will keep in strict confidence any business secret received by it from the other Party (the "Disclosing Party") and, without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, may not disclose such information to any third party or, if it fails to do so, be liable for any loss incurred by the Disclosing Party, unless such information:
perturbation.changed_text: 8.3 Each Company (the "Receiving Party") will keep in strict confidence any business secret received by it from the other Party (the "Disclosing Party") and, without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, may not disclose such information to any third party or, if it fails to do so, be liable for any loss incurred by the Disclosing Party, unless such information:
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to any 'Party' whereas the modified text refers to each 'Company'. There can be a conflict, since Party A is defined as Beijing Baidu Netcom Science and Technology Co., Ltd., so is Party A a 'Party' or a 'Company?' This small change introduces the uncertainty if all Parties can be considered Companies.
